title: Tasawwuf
description: A collection of miniature paintings inspired by Sufism and Rumi’s vision of solitude, surrender, and divine companionship. Each piece reflects a stage of spiritual awakening from yearning and purification to inner illumination and union.

paintings.name: Whisper of Solitude
paintings.materials: Gouache, gold leaf, handmade wasli paper
paintings.process: Layered washes, micro detailing, dry-brush textures
paintings.description: A quiet chamber of the soul where the seeker withdraws from the noise of the world. The painting holds the moment when silence becomes a companion, and solitude turns into a doorway to God.
paintings.quote: “Silence is the language of God; all else is poor translation.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Light of Repentance
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: The soft illumination that enters the heart the moment it bows in humility. The bees, flowers, and shifting sky echo the soul’s rise from heaviness toward clarity.
paintings.quote: “When the soul lies down in that grass, the world is too full to talk about.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Sanctuary Within
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered organic forms
paintings.description: A sacred inner dwelling where the seeker discovers that safety was never in the world it was always within. The nest cradles the self in a protective embrace of divine mercy.
paintings.quote: “What you seek is seeking you.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Waiting at the Threshold
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: A soul seated between earth and sky, waiting without complaint. The stillness honors the patience required before divine openings.
paintings.quote: “When the soul is ready, its teacher appears.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Heaven Embracing Earth
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: A symbolic union of the celestial and the earthly where human fragility touches divine compassion. Flowers bloom around spiritual awareness.
paintings.quote: “Wherever you stand, be the soul of that place.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Unfolding of the Heart
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: The heart opening in stages sometimes through softness, sometimes through pain. The gold leaf signifies the divine truths revealed only to the patient.
paintings.quote: “Raise your words, not your voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Freedom Beyond the World
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: A mystical freedom unbound by the weight of earthly concerns. Birds, open skies, and spiritual companions guide the seeker higher.
paintings.quote: “Why are you so busy with this or that or good or bad? Pay attention to how things blend.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Loneliness with God
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: A depiction of the sacred solitude where companionship is purely divine. The seeker is surrounded by creation, yet inwardly turned toward the Beloved.
paintings.quote: “When I am with you, we stay up all night. When you are not here, I cannot sleep.” — Rumi

paintings.name: The Eternal Moment
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: A frozen instant of spiritual union where past and future dissolve. All creation bears witness as the soul meets the Divine without veil.
paintings.quote: “Close your eyes. Fall in love. Stay there.” — Rumi

paintings.name: Metanoia
paintings.process: Wet-on-dry, dot detailing, layered petal strokes
paintings.description: The turning of the soul a full transformation from sorrow to surrender, from the weight of the world to divine companionship.
paintings.quote: “Be melting snow. Wash yourself of yourself.” — Rumi
